message: Not sure we'll end up actually using this, but it seems like it might be a useful tool.
Almost forgot about this. I'll start pointing people here and see how it goes!
No OpenID support, only Twitter and Facebook login :| Also, kind of like Wave minus all the extras, heh
testing. 123
I like the way it keeps the logs, wonder how useful it is for storing large conversations.
@Spiney Well threading is needed, but I recall seeing that on their todo list so it'd be pretty awesome.
@TheAncientGoat True, that is kinda a bummer. But It 'just' launched so I bet they'll be adding it.
@LynneaWyn Awesome failure there. :P
I started to say something then... writer's block.
@BiosElement Thank you, I practiced for years to pinpoint the perfectly precise place to draw a blank. Oo, and look at all at alliteration.
So, 4 people out of the 40 have checked out Convore :P Has anyone pointed people to it in the IRC channel?

And for reference, done some poking around into a chat system for Drupal...kinda defeats the point of changing. Convore is genuinely easier to use then IRC and less work to maintain. Hosting it will just make it more work with no real ease of use benefits.
@TheAncientGoat No, I haven't done more then a single thread on the forums.
I disagree that Convore is easier to use; You have to sign up to post messages whereas IRC doesn't require that. It is slightly nicer though

@TheAncientGoat And if you have a Facebook/Twitter account it's 3 clicks and you're done. IRC requires either a painful-to-use web client or an installed application which can be a pain. For people who have never used IRC before, that's a pretty high barrier.
And for an awesome bonus, there are complete logs stored here, meaning you don't have to be connected 24/7. ^_^
The web client isn't that painfull to use :\
@TheAncientGoat I've used it, don't lie. ;) I was stuck on it for a weekend, that was 'not' fun.
Maybe I'm more forgiving :P
I take that back. Convore seems to have a grudge against Android :(

I'm personally not a big fan of IRC, so I will avoid it at all costs. If it's not absolutely necessary to use IRC, I won't. I don't stay at one computer long enough to really make it useful. 

Besides, I think I can access Convore from my phone, so bonus points for that in my opinion. :)
@PopeJamal It's got an API and I understand there's several devs working on an android app. ^_^
